author: Sara Randazzo
title: Tulsa Sheriff’s Office to Pay $6 Million to Family of Unarmed Man Shot Dead
text:
The Tulsa County Sheriff’s Office agreed to pay $6 million to the family of Eric Harris, an unarmed black man killed by a white volunteer deputy in 2015, capping a case that helped fuel nationwide protests and rattled law enforcement in Oklahoma.

The civil settlement, filed in Tulsa federal court Friday, follows a 2016 second-degree manslaughter conviction against the former reserve deputy, Robert Bates. Then a 73-year-old insurance executive and sheriff’s office donor, Mr. Bates claimed he mistook his revolver for a stun...
